@dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
 there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
 specific functions.
 The initial owner is set to the address provided by the deployer. This can
 later be changed with {transferOwnership}.
 This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
 `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
 the owner.

documentation.text:
@dev A modifier that defines a protected initializer function that can be invoked at most once. In its scope,
 `onlyInitializing` functions can be used to initialize parent contracts.
 Similar to `reinitializer(1)`, except that in the context of a constructor an `initializer` may be invoked any
 number of times. This behavior in the constructor can be useful during testing and is not expected to be used in
 production.
 Emits an {Initialized} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () pure returns (struct Initializable.InitializableStorage storage pointer)

documentation.text:
@dev A modifier that defines a protected reinitializer function that can be invoked at most once, and only if the
 contract hasn't been initialized to a greater version before. In its scope, `onlyInitializing` functions can be
 used to initialize parent contracts.
 A reinitializer may be used after the original initialization step. This is essential to configure modules that
 are added through upgrades and that require initialization.
 When `version` is 1, this modifier is similar to `initializer`, except that functions marked with `reinitializer`
 cannot be nested. If one is invoked in the context of another, execution will revert.
 Note that versions can jump in increments greater than 1; this implies that if multiple reinitializers coexist in
 a contract, executing them in the right order is up to the developer or operator.
 WARNING: Setting the version to 2**64 - 1 will prevent any future reinitialization.
 Emits an {Initialized} event.

@dev Modifier to protect an initialization function so that it can only be invoked by functions with the
 {initializer} and {reinitializer} modifiers, directly or indirectly.
@dev Reverts if the contract is not in an initializing state. See {onlyInitializing}.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () pure returns (struct Initializable.InitializableStorage storage pointer)

documentation.text:
@dev Locks the contract, preventing any future reinitialization. This cannot be part of an initializer call.
 Calling this in the constructor of a contract will prevent that contract from being initialized or reinitialized
 to any version. It is recommended to use this to lock implementation contracts that are designed to be called
 through proxies.
 Emits an {Initialized} event the first time it is successfully executed.

@dev An upgradeability mechanism designed for UUPS proxies. The functions included here can perform an upgrade of an
 {ERC1967Proxy}, when this contract is set as the implementation behind such a proxy.
 A security mechanism ensures that an upgrade does not turn off upgradeability accidentally, although this risk is
 reinstated if the upgrade retains upgradeability but removes the security mechanism, e.g. by replacing
 `UUPSUpgradeable` with a custom implementation of upgrades.
 The {_authorizeUpgrade} function must be overridden to include access restriction to the upgrade mechanism.
@custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow state-variable-immutable

@dev The version of the upgrade interface of the contract. If this getter is missing, both `upgradeTo(address)`
 and `upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)` are present, and `upgradeTo` must be used if no function should be called,
 while `upgradeToAndCall` will invoke the `receive` function if the second argument is the empty byte string.
 If the getter returns `"5.0.0"`, only `upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)` is present, and the second argument must
 be the empty byte string if no function should be called, making it impossible to invoke the `receive` function
 during an upgrade.

 function through ERC-1167 minimal proxies (clones) would not normally pass this test, but is not guaranteed to
 fail.

@dev Check that the execution is not being performed through a delegate call. This allows a function to be

@dev Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the

 bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this
 function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

@dev Reverts if the execution is not performed via delegatecall or the execution

@dev Provides information about the current execution context, including the
 sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available

@dev Contract module that helps prevent reentrant calls to a function.
 Inheriting from `ReentrancyGuard` will make the {nonReentrant} modifier
 available, which can be applied to functions to make sure there are no nested
 (reentrant) calls to them.
 Note that because there is a single `nonReentrant` guard, functions marked as
 `nonReentrant` may not call one another. This can be worked around by making
 those functions `private`, and then adding `external` `nonReentrant` entry
 points to them.
 TIP: If EIP-1153 (transient storage) is available on the chain you're deploying at,
 consider using {ReentrancyGuardTransient} instead.
 TIP: If you would like to learn more about reentrancy and alternative ways
 to protect against it, check out our blog post
 https://blog.openzeppelin.com/reentrancy-after-istanbul/[Reentrancy After Istanbul].

@dev Replacement for Solidity's `transfer`: sends `amount` wei to
 `recipient`, forwarding all available gas and reverting on errors.
 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1884[EIP1884] increases the gas cost
 of certain opcodes, possibly making contracts go over the 2300 gas limit
 imposed by `transfer`, making them unable to receive funds via
 `transfer`. {sendValue} removes this limitation.
 https://consensys.net/diligence/blog/2019/09/stop-using-soliditys-transfer-now/[Learn more].
 IMPORTANT: because control is transferred to `recipient`, care must be
 taken to not create reentrancy vulnerabilities. Consider using
 {ReentrancyGuard} or the
 https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/v0.8.20/security-considerations.html#use-the-checks-effects-interactions-pattern[checks-effects-interactions pattern].

@dev Performs a Solidity function call using a low level `call`. A

 up by this function (like regular Solidity function calls). However, if
 the call reverted with no returned reason, this function reverts with a
 {Errors.FailedCall} error.
 Returns the raw returned data. To convert to the expected return value,
 use https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/units-and-global-variables.html?highlight=abi.decode#abi-encoding-and-decoding-functions[`abi.decode`].
 Requirements:

devdoc.details: Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to specific functions. The initial owner is set to the address provided by the deployer. This can later be changed with {transferOwnership}. This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to the owner.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.details: This is a base contract to aid in writing upgradeable contracts, or any kind of contract that will be deployed behind a proxy. Since proxied contracts do not make use of a constructor, it's common to move constructor logic to an external initializer function, usually called `initialize`. It then becomes necessary to protect this initializer function so it can only be called once. The {initializer} modifier provided by this contract will have this effect. The initialization functions use a version number. Once a version number is used, it is consumed and cannot be reused. This mechanism prevents re-execution of each "step" but allows the creation of new initialization steps in case an upgrade adds a module that needs to be initialized. For example: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```solidity contract MyToken is ERC20Upgradeable {     function initialize() initializer public {         __ERC20_init("MyToken", "MTK");     } } contract MyTokenV2 is MyToken, ERC20PermitUpgradeable {     function initializeV2() reinitializer(2) public {         __ERC20Permit_init("MyToken");     } } ``` TIP: To avoid leaving the proxy in an uninitialized state, the initializer function should be called as early as possible by providing the encoded function call as the `_data` argument to {ERC1967Proxy-constructor}. CAUTION: When used with inheritance, manual care must be taken to not invoke a parent initializer twice, or to ensure that all initializers are idempotent. This is not verified automatically as constructors are by Solidity. [CAUTION] ==== Avoid leaving a contract uninitialized. An uninitialized contract can be taken over by an attacker. This applies to both a proxy and its implementation contract, which may impact the proxy. To prevent the implementation contract from being used, you should invoke the {_disableInitializers} function in the constructor to automatically lock it when it is deployed: [.hljs-theme-light.nopadding] ```

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

devdoc.details: An upgradeability mechanism designed for UUPS proxies. The functions included here can perform an upgrade of an {ERC1967Proxy}, when this contract is set as the implementation behind such a proxy. A security mechanism ensures that an upgrade does not turn off upgradeability accidentally, although this risk is reinstated if the upgrade retains upgradeability but removes the security mechanism, e.g. by replacing `UUPSUpgradeable` with a custom implementation of upgrades. The {_authorizeUpgrade} function must be overridden to include access restriction to the upgrade mechanism.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

UPGRADE_INTERFACE_VERSION.details: The version of the upgrade interface of the contract. If this getter is missing, both `upgradeTo(address)` and `upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)` are present, and `upgradeTo` must be used if no function should be called, while `upgradeToAndCall` will invoke the `receive` function if the second argument is the empty byte string. If the getter returns `"5.0.0"`, only `upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)` is present, and the second argument must be the empty byte string if no function should be called, making it impossible to invoke the `receive` function during an upgrade.

devdoc.details: Provides information about the current execution context, including the sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application is concerned). This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

devdoc.details: Contract module that helps prevent reentrant calls to a function. Inheriting from `ReentrancyGuard` will make the {nonReentrant} modifier available, which can be applied to functions to make sure there are no nested (reentrant) calls to them. Note that because there is a single `nonReentrant` guard, functions marked as `nonReentrant` may not call one another. This can be worked around by making those functions `private`, and then adding `external` `nonReentrant` entry points to them. TIP: If EIP-1153 (transient storage) is available on the chain you're deploying at, consider using {ReentrancyGuardTransient} instead. TIP: If you would like to learn more about reentrancy and alternative ways to protect against it, check out our blog post https://blog.openzeppelin.com/reentrancy-after-istanbul/[Reentrancy After Istanbul].

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

devdoc.details: ERC-1967: Proxy Storage Slots. This interface contains the events defined in the ERC.

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is changed.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

devdoc.details: ERC-1822: Universal Upgradeable Proxy Standard (UUPS) documents a method for upgradeability through a simplified proxy whose upgrades are fully controlled by the current implementation.

proxiableUUID().details: Returns the storage slot that the proxiable contract assumes is being used to store the implementation address. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy.

devdoc.details: This library provides getters and event emitting update functions for https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1967[ERC-1967] slots.

ERC1967InvalidAdmin(address).details: The `admin` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967InvalidBeacon(address).details: The `beacon` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

ADMIN_SLOT.details: Storage slot with the admin of the contract. This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.admin" subtracted by 1.

BEACON_SLOT.details: The storage slot of the UpgradeableBeacon contract which defines the implementation for this proxy. This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.beacon" subtracted by 1.

IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT.details: Storage slot with the address of the current implementation. This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.implementation" subtracted by 1.

devdoc.details: This is the interface that {BeaconProxy} expects of its beacon.

implementation().details: Must return an address that can be used as a delegate call target. {UpgradeableBeacon} will check that this address is a contract.

devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC-20 standard as defined in the ERC.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

devdoc.details: Required interface of an ERC-721 compliant contract.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

approve(address,uint256).details: Gives permission to `to` to transfer `tokenId` token to another account. The approval is cleared when the token is transferred. Only a single account can be approved at a time, so approving the zero address clears previous approvals. Requirements: - The caller must own the token or be an approved operator. - `tokenId` must exist. Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the number of tokens in ``owner``'s account.

getApproved(uint256).details: Returns the account approved for `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns if the `operator` is allowed to manage all of the assets of `owner`. See {setApprovalForAll}

ownerOf(uint256).details: Returns the owner of the `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`, checking first that contract recipients are aware of the ERC-721 protocol to prevent tokens from being forever locked. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been allowed to move this token by either {approve} or   {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Approve or remove `operator` as an operator for the caller. Operators can call {transferFrom} or {safeTransferFrom} for any token owned by the caller. Requirements: - The `operator` cannot be the address zero. Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. WARNING: Note that the caller is responsible to confirm that the recipient is capable of receiving ERC-721 or else they may be permanently lost. Usage of {safeTransferFrom} prevents loss, though the caller must understand this adds an external call which potentially creates a reentrancy vulnerability. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. Emits a {Transfer} event.

/**
 * @dev Interface of the ERC-165 standard, as defined in the
 * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[ERC].
 *
 * Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be
 * queried by others ({ERC165Checker}).
 *
 * For an implementation, see {ERC165}.
 */
interface IERC165 {
    /**
     * @dev Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by
     * `interfaceId`. See the corresponding
     * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section]
     * to learn more about how these ids are created.
     *
     * This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.
     */
    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns (bool);
}

devdoc.details: Interface for any contract that wants to support safeTransfers from ERC-721 asset contracts.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Whenever an {IERC721} `tokenId` token is transferred to this contract via {IERC721-safeTransferFrom} by `operator` from `from`, this function is called. It must return its Solidity selector to confirm the token transfer. If any other value is returned or the interface is not implemented by the recipient, the transfer will be reverted. The selector can be obtained in Solidity with `IERC721Receiver.onERC721Received.selector`.

devdoc.details: Library for reading and writing primitive types to specific storage slots. Storage slots are often used to avoid storage conflict when dealing with upgradeable contracts. This library helps with reading and writing to such slots without the need for inline assembly. The functions in this library return Slot structs that contain a `value` member that can be used to read or write. Example usage to set ERC-1967 implementation slot: ```solidity contract ERC1967 {     // Define the slot. Alternatively, use the SlotDerivation library to derive the slot.     bytes32 internal constant _IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;     function _getImplementation() internal view returns (address) {         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value;     }     function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) internal {         require(newImplementation.code.length > 0);         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value = newImplementation;     } } ``` TIP: Consider using this library along with {SlotDerivation}.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.tokenAddress: 代币地址 (address(0) 表示 ETH)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

devdoc.details: NFT 拍卖平台升级版本，添加了新功能

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

createAuctionV2(uint256,uint256,uint256,.details: 创建 V2 版本的拍卖

emergencyCancelAuction(uint256).details: 紧急情况下取消拍卖（仅所有者）

getDutchAuctionCurrentPrice(uint256).details: 获取荷兰式拍卖的当前价格

params.tokenAddress: 代币地址 (address(0) 表示 ETH)

getUserBidAmount(uint256,address).details: 获取用户在指定拍卖中的出价记录

getUserParticipatedAuctions(address).details: 获取用户参与的拍卖列表

getUserWonAuctions(address).details: 获取用户赢得的拍卖列表

initializeV2().details: 重新初始化函数（用于升级）

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

placeBidWithToken(uint256,address,uint25.details: 使用 ERC20 代币出价

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setCrossChainBridge(address).details: 设置跨链桥接合约地址

params.tokenAddress: 代币地址 (address(0) 表示 ETH)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.22;\r\n\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721Receiver.sol\";\r\nimport {AggregatorV3Interface} from \"@chainlink/contracts/src/v0.8/shared/interfaces/AggregatorV3Interface.sol\";\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * @title NFTAuctionPlatform\r\n * @dev NFT \u62cd\u5356\u5e73\u53f0\u4e3b\u5408\u7ea6\uff0c\u652f\u6301\u591a\u79cd\u4ee3\u5e01\u51fa\u4ef7\u548c Chainlink \u4ef7\u683c\u9884\u8a00\u673a\r\n */\r\ncontract NFTAuctionPlatform is \r\n    Initializable, \r\n    UUPSUpgradeable, \r\n    OwnableUpgradeable, \r\n    ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable, \r\n    IERC721Receiver \r\n{\r\n    // \u62cd\u5356\u7ed3\u6784\u4f53\r\n    struct Auction {\r\n        address seller;           // \u5356\u5bb6\r\n        uint256 duration;        // \u62cd\u5356\u6301\u7eed\u65f6\u95f4\r\n        uint256 startPrice;      // \u8d77\u59cb\u4ef7\u683c (\u7f8e\u5143\uff0c18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570)\r\n        uint256 startTime;       // \u5f00\u59cb\u65f6\u95f4\r\n        bool ended;              // \u662f\u5426\u7ed3\u675f\r\n        address highestBidder;   // \u6700\u9ad8\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\r\n        uint256 highestBid;      // \u6700\u9ad8\u51fa\u4ef7 (\u7f8e\u5143\uff0c18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570)\r\n        address nftContract;     // NFT \u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n        uint256 tokenId;         // NFT Token ID\r\n        address bidToken;        // \u51fa\u4ef7\u4ee3\u5e01\u5730\u5740 (address(0) \u8868\u793a ETH)\r\n        uint256 originalBidAmount; // \u539f\u59cb\u51fa\u4ef7\u91d1\u989d\r\n        uint256 reservePrice;    // \u4fdd\u7559\u4ef7\u683c (\u7f8e\u5143\uff0c18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570)\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u652f\u6301\u7684\u4ee3\u5e01\u4ef7\u683c\u9884\u8a00\u673a\r\n    mapping(address => AggregatorV3Interface) public priceFeeds;\r\n    \r\n    // \u8de8\u94fe\u6865\u63a5\u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n    address public crossChainBridge;\r\n\r\n    // \u62cd\u5356\u5b58\u50a8\r\n    mapping(uint256 => Auction) public auctions;\r\n    uint256 public nextAuctionId;\r\n    \r\n    // \u7528\u6237\u7684\u51fa\u4ef7\u8bb0\u5f55 (auctionId => bidder => amount in USD)\r\n    mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => uint256)) public bidRecords;\r\n    \r\n    // \u5e73\u53f0\u8d39\u7387 (1000 = 10%)\r\n    uint256 public platformFeeRate;\r\n    address public feeRecipient;\r\n    \r\n    // \u6700\u5c0f\u62cd\u5356\u65f6\u95f4\r\n    uint256 public constant MIN_AUCTION_DURATION = 1 hours;\r\n    uint256 public constant MAX_AUCTION_DURATION = 30 days;\r\n    \r\n    // \u4e8b\u4ef6\u5b9a\u4e49\r\n    event AuctionCreated(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed seller,\r\n        address indexed nftContract,\r\n        uint256 tokenId,\r\n        uint256 startPrice,\r\n        uint256 reservePrice,\r\n        uint256 duration\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event BidPlaced(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed bidder,\r\n        address indexed bidToken,\r\n        uint256 bidAmount,\r\n        uint256 usdValue\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event AuctionEnded(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed winner,\r\n        uint256 finalPrice,\r\n        address paymentToken\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event PriceFeedUpdated(address indexed token, address indexed priceFeed);\r\n    \r\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\r\n    constructor() {\r\n        _disableInitializers();\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u521d\u59cb\u5316\u51fd\u6570\r\n     */\r\n    function initialize() external initializer {\r\n        __Ownable_init(msg.sender);\r\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\r\n        __ReentrancyGuard_init();\r\n        \r\n        nextAuctionId = 1;\r\n        platformFeeRate = 250; // 2.5%\r\n        feeRecipient = msg.sender;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u8bbe\u7f6e\u8de8\u94fe\u6865\u63a5\u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n     * @param _crossChainBridge \u8de8\u94fe\u6865\u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n     */\r\n    function setCrossChainBridge(address _crossChainBridge) external onlyOwner {\r\n        crossChainBridge = _crossChainBridge;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u8bbe\u7f6e\u4ef7\u683c\u9884\u8a00\u673a\r\n     * @param tokenAddress \u4ee3\u5e01\u5730\u5740 (address(0) \u8868\u793a ETH)\r\n     * @param priceFeed \u9884\u8a00\u673a\u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n     */\r\n    function setPriceFeed(address tokenAddress, address priceFeed) external onlyOwner {\r\n        priceFeeds[tokenAddress] = AggregatorV3Interface(priceFeed);\r\n        emit PriceFeedUpdated(tokenAddress, priceFeed);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u521b\u5efa\u62cd\u5356\r\n     * @param duration \u62cd\u5356\u6301\u7eed\u65f6\u95f4\uff08\u79d2\uff09\r\n     * @param startPrice \u8d77\u59cb\u4ef7\u683c\uff08\u7f8e\u5143\uff0c18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570\uff09\r\n     * @param reservePrice \u4fdd\u7559\u4ef7\u683c\uff08\u7f8e\u5143\uff0c18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570\uff09\r\n     * @param nftAddress NFT \u5408\u7ea6\u5730\u5740\r\n     * @param tokenId NFT Token ID\r\n     */\r\n    function createAuction(\r\n        uint256 duration,\r\n        uint256 startPrice,\r\n        uint256 reservePrice,\r\n        address nftAddress,\r\n        uint256 tokenId\r\n    ) external nonReentrant returns (uint256) {\r\n        require(duration >= MIN_AUCTION_DURATION && duration <= MAX_AUCTION_DURATION, \"Invalid duration\");\r\n        require(startPrice > 0, \"Start price must be positive\");\r\n        require(reservePrice >= startPrice, \"Reserve price too low\");\r\n        require(nftAddress != address(0), \"Invalid NFT contract\");\r\n        \r\n        IERC721 nft = IERC721(nftAddress);\r\n        require(nft.ownerOf(tokenId) == msg.sender, \"Not owner of NFT\");\r\n        require(nft.isApprovedForAll(msg.sender, address(this)) || \r\n                nft.getApproved(tokenId) == address(this), \"NFT not approved\");\r\n        \r\n        // \u8f6c\u79fb NFT \u5230\u5408\u7ea6\r\n        nft.safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), tokenId);\r\n        \r\n        uint256 auctionId = nextAuctionId++;\r\n        \r\n        auctions[auctionId] = Auction({\r\n            seller: msg.sender,\r\n            duration: duration,\r\n            startPrice: startPrice,\r\n            startTime: block.timestamp,\r\n            ended: false,\r\n            highestBidder: address(0),\r\n            highestBid: 0,\r\n            nftContract: nftAddress,\r\n            tokenId: tokenId,\r\n            bidToken: address(0),\r\n            originalBidAmount: 0,\r\n            reservePrice: reservePrice\r\n        });\r\n        \r\n        emit AuctionCreated(auctionId, msg.sender, nftAddress, tokenId, startPrice, reservePrice, duration);\r\n        return auctionId;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u4f7f\u7528 ETH \u51fa\u4ef7\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function placeBidWithETH(uint256 auctionId) external payable nonReentrant {\r\n        require(msg.value > 0, \"Bid must be positive\");\r\n        \r\n        uint256 usdValue = getTokenPriceInUSD(address(0), msg.value);\r\n        _placeBid(auctionId, address(0), msg.value, usdValue);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u4f7f\u7528 ERC20 \u4ee3\u5e01\u51fa\u4ef7\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     * @param tokenAddress \u4ee3\u5e01\u5730\u5740\r\n     * @param amount \u4ee3\u5e01\u6570\u91cf\r\n     */\r\n    function placeBidWithToken(\r\n        uint256 auctionId,\r\n        address tokenAddress,\r\n        uint256 amount\r\n    ) external nonReentrant {\r\n        require(amount > 0, \"Amount must be positive\");\r\n        require(tokenAddress != address(0), \"Use placeBidWithETH for ETH\");\r\n        require(address(priceFeeds[tokenAddress]) != address(0), \"Token not supported\");\r\n        \r\n        IERC20 token = IERC20(tokenAddress);\r\n        require(token.balanceOf(msg.sender) >= amount, \"Insufficient balance\");\r\n        require(token.allowance(msg.sender, address(this)) >= amount, \"Insufficient allowance\");\r\n        \r\n        uint256 usdValue = getTokenPriceInUSD(tokenAddress, amount);\r\n        \r\n        // \u8f6c\u79fb\u4ee3\u5e01\u5230\u5408\u7ea6\r\n        token.transferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), amount);\r\n        \r\n        _placeBid(auctionId, tokenAddress, amount, usdValue);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u5185\u90e8\u51fa\u4ef7\u903b\u8f91\r\n     */\r\n    function _placeBid(\r\n        uint256 auctionId,\r\n        address tokenAddress,\r\n        uint256 amount,\r\n        uint256 usdValue\r\n    ) internal virtual {\r\n        Auction storage auction = auctions[auctionId];\r\n        \r\n        require(auction.seller != address(0), \"Auction does not exist\");\r\n        require(!auction.ended, \"Auction ended\");\r\n        require(block.timestamp < auction.startTime + auction.duration, \"Auction expired\");\r\n        require(msg.sender != auction.seller, \"Seller cannot bid\");\r\n        require(usdValue >= auction.startPrice, \"Bid below start price\");\r\n        require(usdValue > auction.highestBid, \"Bid not high enough\");\r\n        \r\n        // \u9000\u8fd8\u4e4b\u524d\u6700\u9ad8\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\u7684\u8d44\u91d1\r\n        if (auction.highestBidder != address(0)) {\r\n            _refundBidder(auction.highestBidder, auction.bidToken, auction.originalBidAmount);\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        // \u66f4\u65b0\u62cd\u5356\u4fe1\u606f\r\n        auction.highestBidder = msg.sender;\r\n        auction.highestBid = usdValue;\r\n        auction.bidToken = tokenAddress;\r\n        auction.originalBidAmount = amount;\r\n        \r\n        // \u8bb0\u5f55\u7528\u6237\u51fa\u4ef7\r\n        bidRecords[auctionId][msg.sender] = usdValue;\r\n        \r\n        // \u5982\u679c\u62cd\u5356\u5269\u4f59\u65f6\u95f4\u5c11\u4e8e15\u5206\u949f\uff0c\u5ef6\u957f15\u5206\u949f\r\n        uint256 timeRemaining = (auction.startTime + auction.duration) - block.timestamp;\r\n        if (timeRemaining < 15 minutes) {\r\n            auction.duration += 15 minutes;\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        emit BidPlaced(auctionId, msg.sender, tokenAddress, amount, usdValue);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u7ed3\u675f\u62cd\u5356\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function endAuction(uint256 auctionId) external nonReentrant {\r\n        Auction storage auction = auctions[auctionId];\r\n        \r\n        require(auction.seller != address(0), \"Auction does not exist\");\r\n        require(!auction.ended, \"Auction already ended\");\r\n        require(\r\n            block.timestamp >= auction.startTime + auction.duration ||\r\n            msg.sender == auction.seller,\r\n            \"Auction not yet ended\"\r\n        );\r\n        \r\n        auction.ended = true;\r\n        \r\n        if (auction.highestBidder != address(0) && auction.highestBid >= auction.reservePrice) {\r\n            // \u62cd\u5356\u6210\u529f\r\n            _executeSuccessfulAuction(auctionId, auction);\r\n        } else {\r\n            // \u62cd\u5356\u5931\u8d25\uff0c\u9000\u8fd8 NFT\r\n            _executeFailedAuction(auctionId, auction);\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        emit AuctionEnded(auctionId, auction.highestBidder, auction.highestBid, auction.bidToken);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u6267\u884c\u6210\u529f\u7684\u62cd\u5356\r\n     */\r\n    function _executeSuccessfulAuction(uint256 auctionId, Auction memory auction) internal {\r\n        // \u8ba1\u7b97\u5e73\u53f0\u8d39\u7528\r\n        uint256 totalAmount = auction.originalBidAmount;\r\n        uint256 platformFee = (totalAmount * platformFeeRate) / 10000;\r\n        uint256 sellerAmount = totalAmount - platformFee;\r\n        \r\n        // \u8f6c\u79fb NFT \u7ed9\u8d62\u5bb6\r\n        IERC721(auction.nftContract).safeTransferFrom(\r\n            address(this),\r\n            auction.highestBidder,\r\n            auction.tokenId\r\n        );\r\n        \r\n        // \u652f\u4ed8\u5356\u5bb6\u548c\u5e73\u53f0\u8d39\u7528\r\n        if (auction.bidToken == address(0)) {\r\n            // ETH \u652f\u4ed8\r\n            (bool success1, ) = payable(auction.seller).call{value: sellerAmount}(\"\");\r\n            require(success1, \"Payment to seller failed\");\r\n            \r\n            if (platformFee > 0) {\r\n                (bool success2, ) = payable(feeRecipient).call{value: platformFee}(\"\");\r\n                require(success2, \"Platform fee transfer failed\");\r\n            }\r\n        } else {\r\n            // ERC20 \u4ee3\u5e01\u652f\u4ed8\r\n            IERC20 token = IERC20(auction.bidToken);\r\n            require(token.transfer(auction.seller, sellerAmount), \"Payment to seller failed\");\r\n            \r\n            if (platformFee > 0) {\r\n                require(token.transfer(feeRecipient, platformFee), \"Platform fee transfer failed\");\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u6267\u884c\u5931\u8d25\u7684\u62cd\u5356\r\n     */\r\n    function _executeFailedAuction(uint256 auctionId, Auction memory auction) internal {\r\n        // \u9000\u8fd8 NFT \u7ed9\u5356\u5bb6\r\n        IERC721(auction.nftContract).safeTransferFrom(\r\n            address(this),\r\n            auction.seller,\r\n            auction.tokenId\r\n        );\r\n        \r\n        // \u9000\u8fd8\u6700\u9ad8\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\u7684\u8d44\u91d1\r\n        if (auction.highestBidder != address(0)) {\r\n            _refundBidder(auction.highestBidder, auction.bidToken, auction.originalBidAmount);\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u9000\u8fd8\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\u8d44\u91d1\r\n     */\r\n    function _refundBidder(address bidder, address tokenAddress, uint256 amount) internal {\r\n        if (tokenAddress == address(0)) {\r\n            // \u9000\u8fd8 ETH\r\n            (bool success, ) = payable(bidder).call{value: amount}(\"\");\r\n            require(success, \"ETH refund failed\");\r\n        } else {\r\n            // \u9000\u8fd8 ERC20 \u4ee3\u5e01\r\n            IERC20 token = IERC20(tokenAddress);\r\n            require(token.transfer(bidder, amount), \"Token refund failed\");\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u83b7\u53d6\u4ee3\u5e01\u7684\u7f8e\u5143\u4ef7\u683c\r\n     * @param tokenAddress \u4ee3\u5e01\u5730\u5740 (address(0) \u8868\u793a ETH)\r\n     * @param amount \u4ee3\u5e01\u6570\u91cf\r\n     * @return \u7f8e\u5143\u4ef7\u503c (18\u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570)\r\n     */\r\n    function getTokenPriceInUSD(address tokenAddress, uint256 amount) public view returns (uint256) {\r\n        AggregatorV3Interface priceFeed = priceFeeds[tokenAddress];\r\n        require(address(priceFeed) != address(0), \"Price feed not set\");\r\n        \r\n        (, int256 price, , , ) = priceFeed.latestRoundData();\r\n        require(price > 0, \"Invalid price\");\r\n        \r\n        uint8 decimals = priceFeed.decimals();\r\n        \r\n        // \u5c06\u4ef7\u683c\u8f6c\u6362\u4e3a 18 \u4f4d\u5c0f\u6570\uff0c\u7136\u540e\u4e58\u4ee5\u6570\u91cf\r\n        uint256 priceInUSD = (uint256(price) * (10 ** 18)) / (10 ** decimals);\r\n        return (priceInUSD * amount) / (10 ** 18);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u83b7\u53d6\u62cd\u5356\u4fe1\u606f\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function getAuction(uint256 auctionId) external view returns (Auction memory) {\r\n        return auctions[auctionId];\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u68c0\u67e5\u62cd\u5356\u662f\u5426\u6d3b\u8dc3\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function isAuctionActive(uint256 auctionId) external view returns (bool) {\r\n        Auction memory auction = auctions[auctionId];\r\n        return !auction.ended && \r\n               block.timestamp < auction.startTime + auction.duration &&\r\n               auction.seller != address(0);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u83b7\u53d6\u5269\u4f59\u65f6\u95f4\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function getTimeRemaining(uint256 auctionId) external view returns (uint256) {\r\n        Auction memory auction = auctions[auctionId];\r\n        if (auction.ended || block.timestamp >= auction.startTime + auction.duration) {\r\n            return 0;\r\n        }\r\n        return (auction.startTime + auction.duration) - block.timestamp;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u83b7\u53d6\u7528\u6237\u5728\u6307\u5b9a\u62cd\u5356\u4e2d\u7684\u51fa\u4ef7\u8bb0\u5f55\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     * @param bidder \u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\u5730\u5740\r\n     */\r\n    function getUserBidAmount(uint256 auctionId, address bidder) external view returns (uint256) {\r\n        return bidRecords[auctionId][bidder];\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u8bbe\u7f6e\u5e73\u53f0\u8d39\u7387\r\n     * @param newFeeRate \u65b0\u8d39\u7387 (1000 = 10%)\r\n     */\r\n    function setPlatformFeeRate(uint256 newFeeRate) external onlyOwner {\r\n        require(newFeeRate <= 1000, \"Fee rate too high\"); // \u6700\u5927 10%\r\n        platformFeeRate = newFeeRate;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u8bbe\u7f6e\u8d39\u7528\u63a5\u6536\u8005\r\n     * @param newFeeRecipient \u65b0\u7684\u8d39\u7528\u63a5\u6536\u8005\u5730\u5740\r\n     */\r\n    function setFeeRecipient(address newFeeRecipient) external onlyOwner {\r\n        require(newFeeRecipient != address(0), \"Invalid address\");\r\n        feeRecipient = newFeeRecipient;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u7d27\u6025\u60c5\u51b5\u4e0b\u53d6\u6d88\u62cd\u5356\uff08\u4ec5\u6240\u6709\u8005\uff09\r\n     * @param auctionId \u62cd\u5356 ID\r\n     */\r\n    function emergencyCancelAuction(uint256 auctionId) external onlyOwner {\r\n        Auction storage auction = auctions[auctionId];\r\n        require(auction.seller != address(0), \"Auction does not exist\");\r\n        require(!auction.ended, \"Auction already ended\");\r\n        \r\n        auction.ended = true;\r\n        \r\n        // \u9000\u8fd8 NFT\r\n        IERC721(auction.nftContract).safeTransferFrom(\r\n            address(this),\r\n            auction.seller,\r\n            auction.tokenId\r\n        );\r\n        \r\n        // \u9000\u8fd8\u6700\u9ad8\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\u8d44\u91d1\r\n        if (auction.highestBidder != address(0)) {\r\n            _refundBidder(auction.highestBidder, auction.bidToken, auction.originalBidAmount);\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // ERC721 \u63a5\u6536\u5668\r\n    function onERC721Received(\r\n        address,\r\n        address,\r\n        uint256,\r\n        bytes calldata\r\n    ) external pure override returns (bytes4) {\r\n        return IERC721Receiver.onERC721Received.selector;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u5347\u7ea7\u6388\u6743\r\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(address newImplementation) internal override onlyOwner {}\r\n}","keccak256":"0xfa29688d91a3f046278cdd8eb18c32283e079125cc26be30ea1336bc33d81295","license":"MIT"},"contracts/task3/NFTAuctionPlatformV2.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.22;\r\n\r\nimport \"./NFTAuctionPlatform.sol\";\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * @title NFTAuctionPlatformV2\r\n * @dev NFT \u62cd\u5356\u5e73\u53f0\u5347\u7ea7\u7248\u672c\uff0c\u6dfb\u52a0\u4e86\u65b0\u529f\u80fd\r\n */\r\ncontract NFTAuctionPlatformV2 is NFTAuctionPlatform {\r\n    // \u65b0\u7248\u672c\u6dfb\u52a0\u7684\u529f\u80fd\r\n    \r\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\r\n    constructor() {\r\n        _disableInitializers();\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u62cd\u5356\u7c7b\u578b\u679a\u4e3e\r\n    enum AuctionType {\r\n        ENGLISH,     // \u82f1\u5f0f\u62cd\u5356\uff08\u4ef7\u683c\u9012\u589e\uff09\r\n        DUTCH,       // \u8377\u5170\u5f0f\u62cd\u5356\uff08\u4ef7\u683c\u9012\u51cf\uff09\r\n        SEALED_BID   // \u5bc6\u5c01\u51fa\u4ef7\u62cd\u5356\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u6269\u5c55\u7684\u62cd\u5356\u7ed3\u6784\r\n    struct AuctionV2 {\r\n        AuctionType auctionType;    // \u62cd\u5356\u7c7b\u578b\r\n        uint256 decreaseRate;       // \u8377\u5170\u5f0f\u62cd\u5356\u7684\u4ef7\u683c\u9012\u51cf\u7387\uff08\u6bcf\u5c0f\u65f6\uff09\r\n        uint256 revealDeadline;     // \u5bc6\u5c01\u51fa\u4ef7\u62cd\u5356\u7684\u63ed\u793a\u622a\u6b62\u65f6\u95f4\r\n        uint256 buyNowPrice;        // \u4e00\u53e3\u4ef7\u8d2d\u4e70\u4ef7\u683c\r\n        bool allowBuyNow;           // \u662f\u5426\u5141\u8bb8\u4e00\u53e3\u4ef7\u8d2d\u4e70\r\n        uint256 minimumBidIncrement; // \u6700\u5c0f\u51fa\u4ef7\u589e\u91cf\r\n        address[] bidTokenWhitelist; // \u5141\u8bb8\u7684\u51fa\u4ef7\u4ee3\u5e01\u767d\u540d\u5355\r\n        bool isWhitelistEnabled;    // \u662f\u5426\u542f\u7528\u767d\u540d\u5355\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u5bc6\u5c01\u51fa\u4ef7\u7ed3\u6784\r\n    struct SealedBid {\r\n        bytes32 commitment;         // \u51fa\u4ef7\u627f\u8bfa\uff08\u54c8\u5e0c\uff09\r\n        uint256 deposit;           // \u4fdd\u8bc1\u91d1\r\n        bool revealed;             // \u662f\u5426\u5df2\u63ed\u793a\r\n        uint256 actualBid;         // \u5b9e\u9645\u51fa\u4ef7\uff08\u63ed\u793a\u540e\uff09\r\n        address bidToken;          // \u51fa\u4ef7\u4ee3\u5e01\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u5b58\u50a8\u6269\u5c55\u4fe1\u606f\r\n    mapping(uint256 => AuctionV2) public auctionsV2;\r\n    \r\n    // \u5bc6\u5c01\u51fa\u4ef7\u5b58\u50a8 (auctionId => bidder => SealedBid)\r\n    mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => SealedBid)) public sealedBids;\r\n    \r\n    // \u62cd\u5356ID\u5230\u53c2\u4e0e\u8005\u5217\u8868\u7684\u6620\u5c04\r\n    mapping(uint256 => address[]) public auctionParticipants;\r\n    \r\n    // \u62cd\u5356\u7edf\u8ba1\u4fe1\u606f\r\n    struct AuctionStats {\r\n        uint256 totalBids;\r\n        uint256 uniqueBidders;\r\n        uint256 averageBidAmount;\r\n        uint256 lastBidTime;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    mapping(uint256 => AuctionStats) public auctionStats;\r\n    \r\n    // \u7528\u6237\u62cd\u5356\u5386\u53f2\r\n    mapping(address => uint256[]) public userParticipatedAuctions;\r\n    mapping(address => uint256[]) public userWonAuctions;\r\n    \r\n    // \u6279\u91cf\u64cd\u4f5c\u652f\u6301\r\n    struct BatchCreateParams {\r\n        uint256 duration;\r\n        uint256 startPrice;\r\n        uint256 reservePrice;\r\n        address nftContract;\r\n        uint256[] tokenIds;\r\n        AuctionType auctionType;\r\n        uint256 buyNowPrice;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    // \u65b0\u4e8b\u4ef6\r\n    event AuctionV2Created(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        AuctionType indexed auctionType,\r\n        uint256 buyNowPrice,\r\n        uint256 minimumBidIncrement\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event BuyNowPurchase(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed buyer,\r\n        uint256 price,\r\n        address paymentToken\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event SealedBidCommitted(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed bidder,\r\n        bytes32 commitment,\r\n        uint256 deposit\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event SealedBidRevealed(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        address indexed bidder,\r\n        uint256 actualBid\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event DutchAuctionPriceUpdate(\r\n        uint256 indexed auctionId,\r\n        uint256 currentPrice,\r\n        uint256 timestamp\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    event BatchAuctionCreated(\r\n        uint256[] auctionIds,\r\n        address indexed creator,\r\n        AuctionType auctionType\r\n    );\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u91cd\u65b0\u521d\u59cb\u5316\u51fd\u6570\uff08\u7528\u4e8e\u5347\u7ea7\uff09\r\n     */\r\n    function initializeV2() external reinitializer(2) {\r\n        // V2 \u7248\u672c\u7684\u521d\u59cb\u5316\u903b\u8f91\r\n        // \u8fd9\u91cc\u53ef\u4ee5\u6dfb\u52a0\u65b0\u7248\u672c\u7279\u6709\u7684\u521d\u59cb\u5316\u4ee3\u7801\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u521b\u5efa V2 \u7248\u672c\u7684\u62cd\u5356\r\n     */\r\n    function createAuctionV2(\r\n        uint256 duration,\r\n        uint256 startPrice,\r\n        uint256 reservePrice,\r\n        address nftAddress,\r\n        uint256 tokenId,\r\n        AuctionType auctionType,\r\n        uint256 buyNowPrice,\r\n        uint256 minimumBidIncrement,\r\n        address[] calldata bidTokenWhitelist\r\n    ) external nonReentrant returns (uint256) {\r\n        // \u8c03\u7528\u7236\u5408\u7ea6\u7684\u521b\u5efa\u62cd\u5356\u51fd\u6570\r\n        uint256 auctionId = nextAuctionId++;\r\n        \r\n        IERC721 nft = IERC721(nftAddress);\r\n        require(nft.ownerOf(tokenId) == msg.sender, \"Not owner of NFT\");\r\n        require(nft.isApprovedForAll(msg.sender, address(this)) || \r\n                nft.getApproved(tokenId) == address(this), \"NFT not approved\");\r\n        \r\n        // \u8f6c\u79fb NFT \u5230\u5408\u7ea6\r\n        nft.safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), tokenId);\r\n        \r\n        auctions[auctionId] = Auction({\r\n            seller: msg.sender,\r\n            duration: duration,\r\n            startPrice: startPrice,\r\n            startTime: block.timestamp,\r\n            ended: false,\r\n            highestBidder: address(0),\r\n            highestBid: 0,\r\n            nftContract: nftAddress,\r\n            tokenId: tokenId,\r\n            bidToken: address(0),\r\n            originalBidAmount: 0,\r\n            reservePrice: reservePrice\r\n        });\r\n        \r\n        emit AuctionCreated(auctionId, msg.sender, nftAddress, tokenId, startPrice, reservePrice, duration);\r\n        \r\n        // \u8bbe\u7f6e V2 \u7279\u6709\u7684\u5c5e\u6027\r\n        AuctionV2 storage auctionV2 = auctionsV2[auctionId];\r\n        auctionV2.auctionType = auctionType;\r\n        auctionV2.buyNowPrice = buyNowPrice;\r\n        auctionV2.allowBuyNow = buyNowPrice > 0;\r\n        auctionV2.minimumBidIncrement = minimumBidIncrement;\r\n        auctionV2.bidTokenWhitelist = bidTokenWhitelist;\r\n        auctionV2.isWhitelistEnabled = bidTokenWhitelist.length > 0;\r\n        \r\n        if (auctionType == AuctionType.DUTCH) {\r\n            require(reservePrice < startPrice, \"Invalid price range for Dutch auction\");\r\n            auctionV2.decreaseRate = (startPrice - reservePrice) / (duration / 1 hours);\r\n        } else if (auctionType == AuctionType.SEALED_BID) {\r\n            auctionV2.revealDeadline = block.timestamp + duration + 1 days; // \u51fa\u4ef7\u7ed3\u675f\u540e1\u5929\u5185\u63ed\u793a\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        // \u521d\u59cb\u5316\u7edf\u8ba1\u4fe1\u606f\r\n        auctionStats[auctionId] = AuctionStats({\r\n            totalBids: 0,\r\n            uniqueBidders: 0,\r\n            averageBidAmount: 0,\r\n            lastBidTime: 0\r\n        });\r\n        \r\n        emit AuctionV2Created(auctionId, auctionType, buyNowPrice, minimumBidIncrement);\r\n        return auctionId;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u6279\u91cf\u521b\u5efa\u62cd\u5356\r\n     */\r\n    function batchCreateAuctions(BatchCreateParams calldata params) \r\n        external \r\n        nonReentrant \r\n        returns (uint256[] memory) \r\n    {\r\n        require(params.tokenIds.length > 0, \"No tokens provided\");\r\n        require(params.tokenIds.length <= 50, \"Too many tokens\"); // \u9650\u5236\u6279\u91cf\u6570\u91cf\r\n        \r\n        uint256[] memory auctionIds = new uint256[](params.tokenIds.length);\r\n        \r\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < params.tokenIds.length; new address[](0) // bidTokenWhitelist\r\n            );\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        emit BatchAuctionCreated(auctionIds, msg.sender, params.auctionType);\r\n        return auctionIds;\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u4e00\u53e3\u4ef7\u8d2d\u4e70\r\n     */\r\n    function buyNow(uint256 auctionId, address paymentToken) external payable nonReentrant {\r\n        Auction memory \r\n        // \u68c0\u67e5\u652f\u4ed8\r\n        uint256 usdPrice = auctionV2.buyNowPrice;\r\n        if (paymentToken == address(0)) {\r\n            uint256 usdValue = require(auctionV2.auctionType == AuctionType.SEALED_BID, \"Not a sealed bid auction\");\r\n        require(block.timestamp < auction.startTime + auction.duration, \"Bidding period ended\");\r\n        require(msg.value > 0, \"Must send deposit\");\r\n        \r\n        SealedBid storage bid = sealedBids[auctionId][msg.sender];\r\n        require(bid.commitment == bytes32(0), \"Already committed\");\r\n        \r\n        bid.commitment = commitment;\r\n        bid.deposit = msg.value;\r\n        bid.revealed = false;\r\n        \r\n        // \u6dfb\u52a0\u5230\u53c2\u4e0e\u8005\u5217\u8868\r\n        auctionParticipants[auctionId].push(msg.sender);\r\n        userParticipatedAuctions[msg.sender].push(auctionId);\r\n        \r\n        emit SealedBidCommitted(auctionId, msg.sender, commitment, msg.value);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u63ed\u793a\u5bc6\u5c01\u51fa\u4ef7\r\n     */\r\n    function revealSealedBid(\r\n    \r\n        emit SealedBidRevealed(auctionId, msg.sender, bidAmount);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev \u83b7\u53d6\u8377\u5170\u5f0f\u62cd\u5356\u7684\u5f53\u524d\u4ef7\u683c\r\n  uint256 timeElapsed = block.timestamp - auction.startTime;\r\n        uint256 priceDecrease = (timeElapsed / 1 hours) * auctionV2.decreaseRate;\r\n        \r\n        if (priceDecrease >=  */\r\n    function _isTokenWhitelisted(uint256 auctionId, address token) internal view returns (bool) {\r\n        AuctionV2 memory auctionV2 = auctionsV2[auctionId];\r\n        \r\n        if \u6839\u636e\u7f8e\u5143\u4ef7\u503c\u8ba1\u7b97\u6240\u9700\u7684\u4ee3\u5e01\u6570\u91cf\r\n     */\r\n    function _calculateTokenAmount(address token, uint256 usdValue) internal view returns (uint256) {\r\n        AggregatorV3Interface priceFeed = priceFeeds[token];\r\n        require(address(priceFeed) != address(0), \"Price feed not set\");\r\n        \r\n        (, int256 price, , , ) = priceFeed.latestRoundData();\r\n        require(price > 0, \"Invalid price\");\r\n        \r\n        uint8 decimals = priceFeed.decimals();\r\n        uint256 priceInUSD = (uint256(price) * (10 ** \r\n        // \u8c03\u7528\u7236\u5408\u7ea6\u7684\u51fa\u4ef7\u903b\u8f91\r\n        super._placeBid(auctionId, tokenAddress, amount, usdValue);\r\n        \r\n        //   // \u68c0\u67e5\u662f\u5426\u4e3a\u65b0\u7684\u51fa\u4ef7\u8005\r\n        bool isNewBidder = bidRecords[auctionId][msg.sender] == 0;\r\n        if (isNewBidder) {\r\n
